channel.title: üè¢ University of California, San Diego on NeurIPS 2024
channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ University of California, San Diego on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: DiffTORI: Differentiable Trajectory Optimization for Deep Reinforcement and Imitation Learning
item.description: DiffTORI leverages differentiable trajectory optimization for superior deep reinforcement and imitation learning, outperforming prior state-of-the-art methods on high-dimensional robotic tasks.

item.title: MeshFormer : High-Quality Mesh Generation with 3D-Guided Reconstruction Model
item.description: MeshFormer: High-quality 3D mesh generation from sparse views in seconds, using transformers and 3D convolutions.

item.title: Probablistic Emulation of a Global Climate Model with Spherical DYffusion
item.description: Spherical DYffusion: a novel AI model generates accurate, physically consistent global climate ensemble simulations, surpassing existing methods in efficiency and skill.

item.title: Stable Minima Cannot Overfit in Univariate ReLU Networks: Generalization by Large Step Sizes
item.description: Deep ReLU networks trained with large, constant learning rates avoid overfitting in univariate regression due to minima stability, generalizing well even with noisy labels.
